Simulate linear response data.

generate_y_linear.Rd

Generate linear response data with a specified error distribution given the observed and unobserved design matrices.

generate_y_linear(
  X,
  U,
  betas,
  betas_unobs,
  err = NULL,
  return_support = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

X

Design data matrix of observed variables.
U

Design data matrix of unobserved (omitted) variables.
betas

Coefficient vector for observed design matrix.
betas_unobs

Coefficient vector for unobserved design matrix.
err

Function from which to generate simulate error vector. Default is NULL which adds no error to the DGP.
return_support

Logical specifying whether or not to return a vector of the support column names. If X has no column names, then the indices of the support are used.
...

Other arguments to pass to err() to generate the error vector.

Value

If return_support = TRUE, returns a list of two:

y

A response vector of length nrow(X).

support

A vector of feature indices in the true support of the DGP.

If return_support = FALSE, returns only the response vector y.

Examples

X <- generate_X_gaussian(n = 100, p = 2)
U <- generate_X_gaussian(n = 100, p = 2)

# generate the response from: y = 3*x_1 - x_2 + N(0, 1) errors
y <- generate_y_linear(X = X, betas = c(3, -1), err = rnorm)

# generate the response from: y = 3*x_1 - x_2 + u_1 + 2*u_2
y <- generate_y_linear(X = X, U = U, betas = c(3, -1), betas_unobs = c(1, 2))
